title: (x) Marvin Berry and The Starlighters logo on bass drum - various alternatives {gang}
content:
Could anybody please identify the fonts used in [this logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143245/http:/a686.ac-images.myspacecdn.com/images01/73/l_45d56f801f3a47dacb093a9be76baf15.jpg) or direct me to similar ones?

 [‹ (x) Serif headlines on Wired and Guardian websites - Georgia {Dav, Eric Doctor}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143245/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45550 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bodoni w/ extremely thin hairlines on Vanity Fair cover- H&FJ Didot {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143245/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45549 "Go to next forum topic")
author: zap_rowsdower

comments.content:
[Placard](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143245/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/placard-mt/) might be pretty close in a digital type for “STARLIGHTERS” (I say that because I believe this was pre-digital). The script (Marvin Berry) is harder to match, but there are a number of fonts in Part 7 of my Script Font ID Guide that are possibly close enough. I looked mainly for the M and B, then for a similar ’r’ style. Closest choices to me were: [Sarah Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143245/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg6.html), [Swingdancer](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143245/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg7.html), [Snapper Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143245/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg8.html), and [Nitro DNA](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143245/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg10.html) (if you stretch it vertically).

- Mike Yanega
Thanks for taking the time to assist me. You’ve been a tremendous help! Thank you very much!
